alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 27 at 4:45PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Mendenhall Lake and River. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from a glacier-dammed lake outburst across the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Mendenhall Lake and River. - Areas around the glacier visitor center, the Mendenhall campground, Skaters Cabin Road, View Drive and possibly below Back Loop bridge is the most likely place to experience flooding. - For Mendenhall Lake : At 4:15pm the stage was 9.92 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 11.5 feet is expected late Thursday night. Impacts: At 10.0 feet: Water levels will inundate Mendenhall Campground with up to 3 feet of water covering low areas as well as up to 1.5 feet of water covering Skaters Cabin Road. Portions of West Glacier Trail will be impassable. At 10.4 feet: Significant flooding along the Mendenhall Lake area with more than 3 feet of water in places and the Mendenhall campground will be evacuated. Some homes along View Drive will have up to 3 ft of water in yards. At 10.9 feet: View Drive will be flooded and impassable with significant flooding to some homes in the area. Locations below back loop bridge will begin to see flooding of some yards, significant bank erosion along with hazardous navigation from debris in the river. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing. - If you live near or along the Mendenhall River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
